column4: I just bought a new monitor that says it's max native resolution is 1920x1200. But I can't get the monitor to that res. Both the ubuntu monitor res app and the nvidia X Server Settings app say the max res is 1600x1200. Can anyone help?
your video card might not support the resolution (some nvidia cards don't support over 1600x1200 due to the hack they use to handle full screen antialiasing.)
you could just run at a lower resolution, but I recommend using one that is the right ratio.
yeah, I'm doing graphics work in GIMP. I need native res
